SEARCH
Package gw.api.bean.compare.ui

Class DiffDisplayFactory

java.lang.Object
gw.api.bean.compare.ui.DiffDisplayFactory
public class DiffDisplayFactory extends Object
Creates DiffDisplay objects appropriate for EntityDiffs. Each entity type can have a different DiffDisplay type so, given an EntityDiff, this factory creates a DiffDisplay of the type appropriate for the entity type of the EntityDiff. Customers can register their own DiffDisplay types via the configuration plugin. All DiffDisplay types must have a constructor that takes a single EntityDiff argument.

It is not required that the customer registers a DiffDisplay type for every entity type. If no exact match is found for an entity type the factory looks up the supertype chain (if any) for a match. If that fails it returns the out of box EntityDiffDisplay type.

  • Constructor Details

    • DiffDisplayFactory

      public DiffDisplayFactory(Map<IEntityType,Class<? extends DiffDisplay>> diffDisplayTypesByEntityType)
      Create a new factory with the given type map
      Parameters:
      diffDisplayTypesByEntityType - map of entity types to diff display types. Each diff display type must have a constructor that takes a single EntityDiff argument.

  • Method Details

    • createDiffDisplayForDiff

      public <T extends KeyableBean> DiffDisplay createDiffDisplayForDiff(EntityDiff<T> diff, DiffDisplay.Type diffType)
      Create a new DiffDisplay object appropriate for the given EntityDiff. If a DiffDisplay type is registered that exactly matches the EntityDiff entity type then that type is instantiated and returned. Otherwise the supertype of the entity type is tried, recursively. If no match is found for any of the supertypes then a new EntityDiffDisplay object is returned.
      Type Parameters:
      T - an entity type
      Parameters:
      diff - the diff, must not be null
      Returns:
      a newly created diff display object, never null.
